title: A Kitchen That Doubles as an Art Gallery
text:
When New York designer Jeffrey Goodman embarked on the redesign of a kitchen as part of a 14-month renovation of the full home in Manhattan’s SoHo neighborhood, his directive was to give the space a gallery-like feel. The owners, who are in their 60s and work in hospitality, are also art collectors. They wanted a look that would allow their pieces, including works by Damien Hirst, Andy Warhol and Gavin Turk, to shine. “The art was the star,” Mr. Goodman says. “When you’re going to hang art in the kitchen, it’s a focal point. So instead of putting shelves or something, we did the art.”

description: A New York City renovation resulted in a bold and graphic art-filled space to dine in and to admire
